definition: to get/to obtain
to plan/to seek/scheme
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: He got a gravy-train job in the government by pulling strings.
sentences.chinese: 他动用关系在政府部门谋得了一份美差。

sentences.english: LUCY has just found a position in the government.
sentences.chinese: 露西刚在政府部门谋得一职。

sentences.english: Instead, he took a draft-exempt job at the Justice Department.
sentences.chinese: 相反，他在司法部谋得了一个可以免除兵役的位置。

definition: to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
to look for a job/to seek employment
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to plan/to seek/scheme
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
to coax/to beguile/to win over
promote/promotion
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to plunder/to loot/robbery/pillage
stepping-stone to greater power or higher rank
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
power and position (politics)
key job/important position
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
